message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education from the perspective of a primary or secondary school teacher from Bahrain. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements using one of the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', or 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses from a teacher's perspective, considering both positive applications and legitimate concerns about AI in education:

TT4G35A - AI helps teachers write/improve lesson plans: This is a clear positive application. I'll respond "Agree" - this is a reasonable benefit of AI.

TT4G35B - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities: This is another positive application about personalization. I'll respond "Agree" - adaptive learning is a recognized benefit.

TT4G35C - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually: Similar to B, this is about personalized support. I'll respond "Agree" - AI can help with individual attention.

TT4G35D - AI supports students with specific needs: This is about accessibility for multilingual and special education students. I'll respond "Agree" - this is an important accessibility benefit.

TT4G35E - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks: Administrative automation is a clear benefit. I'll respond "Strongly agree" - this is widely recognized.

TT4G35F - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work: This is about academic integrity/plagiarism concerns. I'll respond "Agree" - this is a legitimate concern that many teachers have.

TT4G35G - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate/correct: This is about reliability and accuracy concerns. I'll respond "Agree" - AI can make errors or inappropriate suggestions.

TT4G35H - AI amplifies biases: This is about algorithmic bias. I'll respond "Agree" - this is a well-documented concern.

TT4G35I - AI jeopardizes privacy/security: This is about data protection concerns.
